PC Number: 2003-0054

Date: 2003-01-29

(T.B. Rec. 824817)



 

 

                  Whereas Her Majesty in right of Canada desires to implement the National Airports Policy, the Public Accountability Principles for Canadian Airport Authorities and the Fundamental Principles for the Creation and Operation of Canadian Airport Authorities, which, in part, entails the transfer of the management, operation and maintenance of certain airports in Canada to Canadian Airport Authorities, in order to foster the economic development of the communities which those airports serve as well as the commercial development of those airports with local participation;

 

                  Whereas Her Majesty in right of Canada desires to transfer the management, operation and maintenance of Prince George Airport to Prince George Airport Authority Inc.;

 

                  And whereas Prince George Airport Authority Inc. wishes to assume, on its own behalf and not on behalf of Her Majesty or the Minister of Transport, the management, operation and maintenance of Prince George Airport;

 

                  Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Transport and the Treasury Board hereby:

 

(a) authorizes the Minister of Transport, on behalf of Her Majesty in right of Canada (“Her Majesty”), to enter into the agreement (“Agreement to Transfer”) with Prince George Airport Authority Inc. (“Authority”) in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in Schedule I hereto;

 

(b) pursuant to subsection 16(1) of the Federal Real Property and Federal Immovables Act, authorizes the Minister of Transport, on behalf of Her Majesty:

 

(i) to enter into a lease (“Airport Lease”) with the Authority in respect of Prince George Airport (“Airport”), being the lands described in Schedule II hereto (the parcels described

 .../2


- 2 -

 

secondly and thirdly only after administration and control has been transferred from Her Majesty in right of the Province of British Columbia to Her Majesty, represented by the Minister of Transport), for a term of sixty (60) years with an option to renew for an additional twenty (20) years, in consideration of the rents and other terms and conditions set out in Appendix “B” to the Agreement to Transfer,

 

(ii)to add to the demised premises in the Airport Lease any lands adjacent to or in the vicinity of the Airport acquired by Her Majesty for the purposes of the Airport pursuant to subsection 8.03.01 of the Agreement to Transfer or subsection 3.13.01 of the Airport Lease,

 

(iii)at any time during the term of the Airport Lease, to accept the surrender by the Authority of its interest in any severed portion of the premises demised in the Airport Lease and to enter into a separate lease with the Authority for that severed portion in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in section 19.02 of the Airport Lease,

 

(iv) at any time during the term of the Airport Lease, to enter into a non-disturbance agreement with any occupant of any part of the premises demised in the Airport Lease in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in section 19.01 of the Airport Lease, and

 

(v) at any time during the term of the Airport Lease, to enter into a landlord acknowledgment agreement with the Authority and any leasehold mortgagee of the Authority in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in section 18.08 of the Airport Lease;

 

(c) pursuant to section 61 of the Financial Administration Act, authorizes the Minister of Transport, on behalf of Her Majesty, to enter into a Bill of Sale with the Authority for the sale of the goods and chattels and consumables that are under the custody and control of the Department of Transport and that are used by

 

.../3


- 3 -

 

 

the Minister of Transport for the management, operation and maintenance of the Airport on the Closing Date, substantially in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in Appendix “C” to the Agreement to Transfer;

 

(d) authorizes the Minister of Transport, on behalf of Her Majesty, to enter into a memorandum of agreement with the Authority with respect to employment, substantially in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in Appendix “G” to the Agreement to Transfer;

 

(e) authorizes the Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, the Minister of Health, the Minister of National Revenue and the Minister of Agriculture and Agri-Food (for the purposes of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency), on behalf of Her Majesty, to enter into an agreement with the Authority with respect to Canadian inspection services, substantially in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in Appendix “E” to the Agreement to Transfer; and

 

(f) pursuant to subsection 2(2) of the Airport Transfer (Miscellaneous Matters) Act, designates:

 

(i) Prince George Airport Authority Inc. as a designated airport authority; and

 

(ii)the day immediately following the closing date defined in the Agreement to Transfer, on which the Minister of Transport is to transfer Prince George Airport to Prince George Airport Authority Inc., as the transfer date for that airport.
